page.title: 05LOCAL NATURE STUDY
page.content: LOCAL NATURE STUDY NEAR NEWBRIDGE The River Almond has a variety of wildlife including otters, water voles, kingfishers, wagtails and eels, brown trout, rainbow trout, sea trout (from Augustto December)and even the occasional salmon. Birds which regularly visit local bird tables are great tit, blue tit, robin, sparrows, greenfinches (only in frosty weather) song thrushes and blackbirds. Summer visitors include swallows and curlews, lapwings.Local trees include oak,syeamore, horse chestnut, elm, (some affected by Dutch elm disease) lime, and rowan. Foxes are not all that numerous but have been seen in local gardens.Badgers also live in this area but the sites of their holts is a well guarded secret. As many new roads have been built recently long dormant poppy seeds have germinated.
